name: Infector++
short_description:
Version 1.0.3 is out! :) (fixed compiliation on VS 2013 update 4 CTP, but VS users have reduced functionality)

Infector is a lightweight IoC Container for doing dependency Injection:
-Exception safe
-Make your code easier to change and refactor
-Remove memory leaks from your application
-No leaks caused by exceptions in constructors
-Simple to use
-Hard to Misuse
-Few headers only library (no compilation)
-Non intrusive
-Objects instatiated only when needed
-Constructor Injection
-C++11 

Do you need smart allocation? Send a ticket I'll seriously reconsider
adding back batch allocation into Infector++

What is a IoC container?
Simple, this is THE glue code of your application, everything is wired up and constructor dependency injection becomes trivial. Improves code maintenability and relieve you from calling "new/delete". All the glue code is near the "main" in the Composition Root and you don't have to search it nor mixing glue code with application logic.
summary: Simple and lightweight IoC Container for C++
